did.abstract: Civil War letters of Hopkins, including after his appointment as chaplain of the 120th Regiment of New York Volunteers, to Mary Ames and Winona C. Ames. Discusses conversion of Fairfax Seminary into a convalescent camp, the surrender of Harpers Ferry, the New York draft riots, the battle of Cold Harbor, the siege of Petersburg, family matters, and the building of a chapel.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Henry H. Hopkins was a military chaplain in the United States Army stationed at Alexandria, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Civil War letters of Hopkins, including after his appointment as chaplain of the 120th Regiment of New York Volunteers, to Mary Ames and Winona C. Ames. Discusses conversion of Fairfax Seminary into a convalescent camp, the surrender of Harpers Ferry, the New York draft riots, the battle of Cold Harbor, the siege of Petersburg, family matters, and the building of a chapel.
